page.title: 05SHAWHEATH/LONGRIDGE CARNIVAL
page.content: This carnival is held every year at the beginning of July. The Carnival Queen and her retinue ride in procession on a decorated lorry followed by queens from other areas such as Mobberley and Ashley, decorated floats, marching bands and people in fancy dress. The parade starts and finishes at the Birkin Centre. There are prizes for the best fancy dress and the best decorated float. After the parade the queen is crowned and then there is a programme of events. This year there was an exhibition of 'break dancing' which consists of robotic movements followed by more traditional Morris Dancers and a selection of pieces played by the St. John's Wood School percussion group. There were stalls selling cakes and fancy goods and teas.
